content: only ldc-double_crochet-2tog /x the left side is a ldc worked into the stitch of the same colour to the left two row below flo the right side is a double_crochet worked into the stitch of the same colour two row below 0 chain chain row 0 is only necessary if this chart makes up part of your bottom shelf notes - column 41 should only be worked if this chart is the last rightmost chart on your shelf - the unnumbered columns marked a and b are a guide to show which colour should be used for that row and should not be worked - stitches in the opposite colour to the row will be always be single_crochet blo for this reason it is not necessary to pay attention to the colour of a given stitch when reading the chart only the symbol matters - sometimes more than one stitch will be worked into the same front loop such as when a ldc follows a double_crochet or a double_crochet follows a rdc some front loops will be skipped entirely such as when a rdc follows a double_crochet izzy and frog horse bookend motif page 7/10 written pattern for chart 3 horse facing left left handed notes - column 41 should only be worked if this is the last rightmost pattern on your shelf instructions for column 41 will be included in square brackets and italics - all single_crochet should be in back loop only - all double_crochet including ldc and rdc should be in front loop only - all odd numbered row will be worked in colour a - all even numbered row will be worked in colour b other than row 0 which will be worked in colour a - sometimes more than one stitch will be worked into the same front loop such as when a ldc follows a double_crochet or a double_crochet follows a rdc some front loops will be skipped entirely such as when a rdc follows a double_crochet if this is the first shelf in your bookcase start at row 0 if this will be worked into pre-existing crochet start at row 1b row 0 in colour a ch41 ch1 turn your work 41 42 row 15 in colour a 1dc 3sc *1dc 1sc repeat from * 3 times 3sc 1dc **1sc 4dc repeat from ** 2 times 11sc 5dc row 1a starting in the second chain from the hook single_crochet in 1dc every chain 40 41 go to row 2 row 16 in colour b 1sc 3dc *1sc 1dc repeat from * 3 row 1b in colour a 40sc 1sc 40 41 times 3dc 1sc 1dc 3sc 1rdc 4sc rldc 7sc 1sc from this point the work should not be turned all row row 17 in colour a *1dc 3sc repeat from * 3 times 1sc should be worked from left to right on the same side the 1dc 1sc 2dc 2sc 2dc 12sc 7dc 1dc stitch count of every row should be 40
